Who we are

Exotica History

Located on a then-lonesome little corner under the Williamsburg Bridge in Brooklyn, Exotica opened its doors on New Yearâ€™s Eve twenty years ago. Owners Andrew Tarlow and Mark Firth hosted and bartended and ended most nights with a hand of cards and pitcher of margaritas.

Chef Caroline Fidanza wrote a daily menu committed to local, seasonal, sustainable foods, and built relationships with the farmers in upstate New York and surrounding regions.

Exotic's expansive bar, a place to sit, read, eat and watch the world go by is the centerpiece of the room, a 90 year old Pullman dining car. Warm wood and aged enamel, like being in the belly of a whale or the protected hold of a ship.

Twenty years later Exotica has carried on the traditions of its early days. A place of occasion. A touchstone for a neighborhood.
